title: Constructivist-based mobile microlearning program for mathematical operations and linguistic expression

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and integer comprehension, ability to construct foundational vocabulary and grammatical structures for explaining mathematical concepts, experience in composing simple textual explanations
context.additional_context: A personalized learning environment using individual devices, offering customized computational problem generation and real-time text feedback. Focuses on integrating language expression (speaking/writing) with mathematical thinking through oral explanation activities and writing practice. Strengthens communication skills via peer assessment and feedback exchange.

learning_goals: Learners solve complex arithmetic problems (mixed operations) with â‰¥80% accuracy within four weeks and explain the problem-solving process using systematic grammatical structures and specialized vocabulary.
Learners analyze and correct error patterns during problem-solving, writing logical textual feedback explaining the root causes of errors.
Learners participate in discussion activities comparing diverse computational strategies through collaboration with peers, improving their ability to articulate their thought processes clearly.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
